intro: Hieracium tanypterum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium tanypterum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread rapidly through its rhizomatous growth system.
